alert.note: Alert for Marion (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Marion County through 400 PM EDT... At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marion, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Morral, New Bloomington and Green Camp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
